1.heading: An Asterix Adventure.
1.title: Goscinny and Uderzo present Asterix and the Vikings : the Book of the Film
1.author: translated by Anthea Bell.
notes: (An Asterix Adventure ; 34)
Translation of: Astérix et les Vikings.

"Meet Chief Timandahaf the Viking, his fierce warriors and his daughter Abba, as Asterix and Obelix do when the Vikings visit Gaul to learn the meaning of fear. For they believe fear will lend them wings, and they'd love to fly. Carried off to the frozen North, trendy young Justforkix from Lutetia claims to know all about it. But will he or someone else put the Vikings to flight?"

2.heading: An Asterix Adventure.
2.title: The Mansions of the Gods
2.author: text by Goscinny ; drawings by Uderzo ; translated by Anthea Bell and Derek Hockridge.
notes: (An Asterix Adventure)
Translation of: Le Domaine des Dieux.

3.heading: An Asterix Adventure.
3.title: Obelix and Co.
3.author: text by Goscinny ; drawings by Uderzo ; translated by Anthea Bell and Derek Hockridge.
notes: (An Asterix Adventure)
Translation of: Obelix et Compagnie.

4.heading: An Asterix Adventure.
4.title: Obelix and Co.
4.author: text by Goscinny ; drawings by Uderzo ; translated by Anthea Bell and Derek Hockridge.
notes: (An Asterix Adventure)

5.heading: An Asterix Adventure.
5.title: Operation Getafix : the book of the film : Goscinny and Uderzo present an Asterix adventure
5.author: translated by Anthea Bell and Derek Hockridge.
notes: (Asterix ; bk. 31)
Based on the film Asterix and the Big Fight (Le Coup du Menhir) "written by Yannik Voigt from the books Asterix and the Soothsayer and Asterix and the Big Fight."
Format is text illustrated with cels from the animated film.

6.heading: An Asterix Adventure.
6.title: René Goscinny and Albert Uderzo present The Twelve Tasks of Asterix
6.author: based on the cartoon film created by Studio Idefix.
notes: Les 12 Travaux d'Astérix.

7.title: Asterix als Gladiator
7.author: Text: Goscinny ; Zeichnungen: Uderzo.
notes: (Grosser Asterix ; Bd. 3)
Translation of: Astérix Gladiateur.

8.title: Asterix als Gladiator
8.author: Text von Rene Goscinny ; Zeichnungen von Albert Uderzo ; Übersetzung aus dem Französischen: Gudrun Penndorf.
notes: (Asterix ; Bd. 3)
Translation of: Astérix Gladiateur.

9.heading: Asterix als Legionär / Text, Goscinny ; Zeichnungen, Uderzo.
notes: (Grosser Asterix ; Bd. 10)
Translation of: Astérix Légionnaire.

10.heading: Asterix als Politklamauk.
10.title: "Bonnhalla am Rhein : Asterix als Politklamauk"
10.author: von Eckart Sackmann
notes: Begins: "Solange Comics nicht als Literatur, sondern lediglich als Ware angesehen wurden, ging man entsprechend willkürlich mit ihnen um. Comics waren 'Material', das sich redaktionell beliebig formen liess. Die Einführung von 'Astérix' durch Kauka is ein Beispiel dafür, wie einer Serie der Zeitgeist aufgepfropft wurde."

11.title: Asterix & Obelix
11.author: Uderzo & Goscinny.
notes: Summary: The Indian chief uses a painted hide to begin the education of Asterix and Obelix.

12.title: Asterix & Obelix
12.author: Uderzo & Goscinny.
12.series: July 17, 1978) "You're the One Who's Not Hip, Obelix!"*
notes: Summary: A lady is walking seductively, and Obelix wonders if she has hip troubles.

13.title: Asterix & Obelix
13.author: Uderzo & Goscinny.
notes: Summary: The chief puts his daughter's hand in Obelix's, and Obelix doesn't understand.

14.title: Asterix & Obelix
14.author: Uderzo & Goscinny.
notes: Summary: Obelix finds out he's engaged to be married.

15.title: Asterix & Obelix
15.author: Uderzo & Goscinny.
15.series: July 20, 1978) "We'll Slip Away in the Dark"*
notes: Summary: Asterix & Obelix make plans to escape the Indian village.

16.title: Asterix & Obelix
16.author: Uderzo & Goscinny.
notes: Summary: Asterix steps on a stick while trying to sneak by the late shift of Indian guards.

17.title: Asterix & Obelix
17.author: Uderzo & Goscinny.
notes: Summary: Obelix makes a gobbling sound and fools the Indian guard.

18.title: Asterix & Obelix
18.author: Uderzo & Goscinny.
18.series: July 24, 1978) "Out of the Frying Pan Into the Smorgasbord"*
notes: Summary: Asterix and Obelix encounter the Scandinavian Navy.

19.title: Asterix & Obelix
19.author: Uderzo & Goscinny.
19.series: July 25, 1978) "Yøu've Been Plåying the Støck Mårket Tøø Løng!"*
notes: Summary: Great Danish (the dog) smells land, but Peer Dimlisen is afraid of falling off the edge of the wørld.

20.title: Asterix & Obelix
20.author: Uderzo & Goscinny.
20.series: July 26, 1978) "Why Tåke the Chånce øf Fålling Øff?"*
notes: Summary: The Scandinavian Navy knows the world is round, but votes to turn back anyhow.

21.title: Asterix & Obelix
21.author: Uderzo & Goscinny.
21.series: Oct. 8, 1978) "It Must Be a Crab-Apple Tree"*
notes: Plates 18-19 of Asterix and the Big Fight (Le Combat des Chefs) edited for distribution as a Sunday page in the Edmonton Journal Comic Book, v. 1, no. 38 (Oct. 7, 1978).
Summary: A Roman corporal (in the albums called Plutoqueprévus in French and Infirmofpurpus in English) is pried from a cauldron and sent to spy on the Gauls disguised as a tree.

22.title: Asterix & Obelix Take on Caesar [videorecording]
22.author: starring Gérard Depardieu, Christian Clavier, Robert Benigni ; dir
notes: Pathé, 2001.
1 dvd-video (106 min) : kleur, geluid, dolby-surround.
Summary: De Gallische vrienden Asterix en Obelix vechten tegen het leger van Julius Caesar in het jaar 50 voor Christus.
Videoversie van de gelijknamige speelfilm.
Frankrijk, Duitsland, Italië : Katharina Renn Productions [etc.], cop. 1999.
Naar de stripverhalen van Albert Uderzo en René Goscinny.
Engels gesproken, niet ondertiteld.

23.heading: Asterix and the Big Fight.
23.title: "It Must Be a Crab-Apple Tree"
23.author: Uderzo & Goscinny.
notes: Plates 18-19 of Asterix and the Big Fight (Le Combat des Chefs) edited for distribution as a Sunday page in the Edmonton Journal Comic Book, v. 1, no. 38 (Oct. 7, 1978).
Summary: A Roman corporal (in the albums called Plutoqueprévus in French and Infirmofpurpus in English) is pried from a cauldron and sent to spy on the Gauls disguised as a tree.

24.heading: Asterix and the Big Fight.
24.title: Operation Getafix : the Book of the Film : Goscinny and Uderzo present an Asterix adventure

Based on the film Asterix and the Big Fight (Le Coup du Menhir) "written by Yannik Voigt from the books Asterix and the Soothsayer and Asterix and the Big Fight."
Format is text illustrated with cels from the animated film.

25.title: Asterix and the Class Act
25.author: written by René Goscinny and Albert Uderzo ; illustrated by Albert Uderzo ; translated by Anthea Bell and Derek Hockridge.
notes: "Fourteen all-new Asterix stories."
Translation from the French of: Astérix et la Rentrée Gauloise.

26.title: Asterix and the Falling Sky
26.author: written and illustrated by Albert Uderzo ; translated by Anthea Bell and Derek Hockridge.
notes: Translation of: Le Ciel lui Tombe sur la Tête.
At head of title: Goscinny and Uderzo present an Asterix adventure.

"The Gauls have only one fear: that the sky may fall on their heads tomorrow. But tomorrow never comes, says chief Vitalstatistix. Or does it? It looks as if it's come at last for Asterix, Obelix and the other villagers. And some surprising new characters fall along with the sky. Our friends soon find themselves in the middle of a space race..."

27.heading: Asterix and the Goths.
27.title: Asterix the Hero
27.author: Goscinny and Uderzo ; translated from the French by Anthea Bell and Derek Hockridge.

28.heading: Asterix and the Great Crossing.
28.title: Asterix Conquers America : the book of the film
28.author: translated by Anthea Bell and Derek Hockridge ; text adapted by Albert Uderzo.
notes: (Asterix ; bk. 34)
'This book is based on the film "Asterix Conquers America" ; The film is adapted from the book "Asterix and the Great Crossing."'
At head of title: Goscinny and Uderzo present an Asterix adventure.
Format is text illustrated with cels from the animated film.

39.title: An Asterix Adventure
notes:
A series designation given on some of the English-language printings of Astérix. For convenience, a list of the main Asterix titles in English is given here:
  1. Asterix the Gaul
  2. Asterix and the Golden Sickle
  3. Asterix and the Goths
  4. Asterix the Gladiator
  5. Asterix and the Banquet
  6. Asterix and Cleopatra
  7. Asterix and the Big Fight
  8. Asterix in Britain
  9. Asterix and the Normans
  10. Asterix the Legionary
  11. Asterix and the Chieftain's Shield
  12. Asterix at the Olympic Games
  13. Asterix and the Cauldron
  14. Asterix in Spain
  15. Asterix and the Roman Agent
  16. Asterix in Switzerland
  17. The Mansions of the Gods
  18. Asterix and the Laurel Wreath
  19. Asterix and the Soothsayer
  20. Asterix in Corsica
  21. Asterix and Caesar's Gift
  22. Asterix and the Great Crossing
  23. Obelix and Co.
  24. Asterix in Belgium
  25. Asterix and the Great Divide
  26. Asterix and the Black Gold
  27. Asterix and Son
  28. Asterix and the Magic Carpet
  29. Asterix and the Secret Weapon
  30. Asterix and Obelix All at Sea
  31. Asterix and the Actress
    and movie adaptations in translation:
  32. Asterix Conquers America
  33. Asterix Versus Caesar
  34. Operation Getafix
  35. The Twelve Tasks of Asterix
